Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: செற்றார்பின் செல்லாப் பெருந்தகைமை காமநோய்உற்றார் அறிவதொன்று அன்று.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The dignity that seeks not him who acts as foe, Is the one thing that loving heart can never know.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A lovesick person ('Kaamanoi Uttraar') is shown on their knees, crawling after their lover who is walking away and clearly acting as an enemy ('Settraarpin Sella').
Layered_Composition.Midground: The concept of 'Perunthagaimai' (great dignity) is personified as a tall, noble, spectral figure. This figure is trying to hold the lover back, to prevent them from this undignified pursuit, but its hands pass right through them.
Layered_Composition.Background: A barren, desolate path, symbolizing the fruitless and demeaning nature of the pursuit. The lovesick person is completely unable to grasp or listen to the noble figure of Dignity.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: Those who are afflicted with lovesickness are incapable of understanding the great dignity of not pursuing someone who has scorned them.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The personification of Dignity as a ghost that the lover cannot perceive or interact with. The act of crawling symbolizes the utter loss of self-respect.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Humiliating, desperate, a loss of dignity, pitiful.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: Bleak, harsh lighting. The landscape is in desolate, gray tones. The figure of Dignity has a faint, sad, ethereal glow that has no effect on the scene.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A low-angle shot that emphasizes the demeaning posture of the crawling lover and the impotence of the ghostly figure of Dignity.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, symbolic realism, with a focus on the painful body language.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Desaturated, high-contrast lighting to create a feeling of harsh reality and despair.

Cultural_Anchors: The loss of self-respect in love
செற்றார் (One who scorns/acts as an enemy)
